titleStmt.title: Myographia nova sive musculorum omnium (in corpore humano hactenus repertorum) accuratissima descriptio, in sex praælectiones distributa Nomina singulorum in suo quæque loco, situque naturali, in æneis musculorum iconibus exarantur: eorum item origines, insertiones, & usus, graphice describuntur, additis insuper ipsius authoris, & aliorum nuperrimis observationibus & inventis. Opera & studio Joannis Browne, serenissimi caroli secundi, britanniarum regis, nec-non nosocomii regalis, quod est ad D. Thomæ, chirurgi ordinarii.
Compleat treatise of the muscles
titleStmt.author: Browne, John, 1642-ca. 1700.
Casseri, Giulio Cesare, ca. 1552-1616.
Molins, William.

publicationStmt.publisher: excudebat Joannes Redmayne, celsissimi principis jacobi ducis eboracensis typographus,

notesStmt.note: First published in 1681 under title: A compleat treatise of the muscles. The description of the muscles is based on William Molins' Myskotomia, and the plates partly on Guilio Casserio's Tabula anatomicae.
Consists mainly of plates with letterpress text on verso.
Reproduction of the original in the Glasgow University Library.
